questions.question: What is Big Data?
choices: Large datasets that traditional tools can't handle
A type of software for data processing
questions.answer: Large datasets that traditional tools can't handle

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of Big Data?
What industry uses Big Data for predictive analytics and patient care improvement?
What is a challenge in handling Big Data?
Which tool is a framework for distributed processing of large datasets?
What is HDFS designed for?
choices: Storing vast amounts of data with high throughput
questions.answer: Storing vast amounts of data with high throughput

questions.question: Which component of Hadoop is responsible for job scheduling?
Spark is primarily known for which feature?
What does RDD stand for in Apache Spark?
Which tool supports both batch and real-time data processing?
What type of database is MongoDB?
Which NoSQL database is known for high performance and scalability?
Which cloud-based data warehouse offers serverless architecture?
Which feature is central to HDFS?
What does Snowflake provide?
choices: A cloud platform for data warehousing and sharing
questions.answer: A cloud platform for data warehousing and sharing

questions.question: What distinguishes real-time processing from batch processing?
choices: It processes data as it arrives
questions.answer: It processes data as it arrives

questions.question: Which tool is used for real-time stream processing?
What is the purpose of Apache NiFi?
What is MapReduce's primary function?
Which stage of MapReduce involves sorting and aggregating data?
Which Python library is specifically designed for Big Data processing in Apache Spark?
What is the main advantage of using Scala for Apache Spark?
choices: Default language for Spark with functional programming features
questions.answer: Default language for Spark with functional programming features

questions.question: Which SQL-like tool is used for querying data stored in HDFS?
What is the main purpose of MapReduce in Big Data processing?
choices: Converting input data into key-value pairs and aggregating them
questions.answer: Converting input data into key-value pairs and aggregating them

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of shell scripting in HDFS?
choices: Automating data ingestion and managing directories
questions.answer: Automating data ingestion and managing directories

questions.question: What is Apache Sqoop used for in Big Data?
choices: Transferring data between Hadoop and relational databases
questions.answer: Transferring data between Hadoop and relational databases

questions.question: Which tool is designed for streaming log data into HDFS or HBase?
What type of API is typically used to fetch data dynamically from web services?
What is a key challenge in real-time data integration?
Which tool supports real-time data pipeline automation with a drag-and-drop interface?

What is Angular?
Which command is used to create a new Angular project using Angular CLI?
Which decorator is used to define an Angular component?
What is a module in Angular?
choices: A container for a group of components, directives, and services
A file that contains HTML templates
questions.answer: A container for a group of components, directives, and services

questions.question: How does Angular support two-way data binding?
What is dependency injection in Angular?
choices: A design pattern that allows classes to receive dependencies
A way to inject HTML templates
A method to connect with databases
questions.answer: A design pattern that allows classes to receive dependencies

questions.question: Which directive is used to iterate over a list in Angular templates?
Which lifecycle hook is called after Angular has initialized all data-bound properties of a directive?
What is the primary purpose of services in Angular?
choices: To share data and logic across components
questions.answer: To share data and logic across components

questions.question: How can you create a service in Angular?
choices: Manually writing a function in a component
By adding it to the bootstrap array

questions.question: What is the role of the RouterModule in Angular?
choices: To enable routing and navigation between views
questions.answer: To enable routing and navigation between views

questions.question: Which Angular directive is used to conditionally display content?
What does the ngOnInit lifecycle hook do?
How do you pass data from a parent component to a child component?
Which of the following is a valid Angular pipe?
How do you handle HTTP requests in Angular?
Which Angular module provides HTTP client functionality?
What is the purpose of the Angular CLI command 'ng serve'?
choices: To compile and serve the application locally
questions.answer: To compile and serve the application locally

questions.question: How do you add Angular Material to your project?
choices: By downloading it from the website

questions.question: What is the use of the 'providers' array in an Angular module?
choices: To register services for dependency injection
questions.answer: To register services for dependency injection

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'bootstrap' array in the Angular module?
choices: It defines the entry component that Angular should bootstrap
It lists all the components in the application
questions.answer: It defines the entry component that Angular should bootstrap

questions.question: Which binding syntax is used for event binding in Angular?
How do you apply CSS styles to an Angular component?
choices: Using the 'styles' or 'styleUrls' properties in the @Component decorator
By linking a global CSS file
questions.answer: Using the 'styles' or 'styleUrls' properties in the @Component decorator

questions.question: Which file typically contains global styles in an Angular project?
What is the purpose of the Angular Router outlet?
How do you guard routes in Angular?
Which Angular decorator is used to create a directive?
What is lazy loading in Angular?
choices: A design pattern to load modules on demand
A technique to delay component initialization
A feature for handling HTTP requests
questions.answer: A design pattern to load modules on demand

questions.question: How do you share data between sibling components in Angular?
choices: By directly accessing each otherâ€™s variables

questions.question: What is the function of the RxJS library in Angular?
choices: To handle asynchronous operations and event streams
questions.answer: To handle asynchronous operations and event streams

questions.question: Which event is triggered when an HTML element loses focus?
Which built-in object can be used to store key-value pairs in JavaScript?
Which JavaScript method is used to select an HTML element by its ID?
What does ECMAScript (ES) refer to?
Which operator is used for optional chaining in JavaScript?
Which of the following is NOT a JavaScript data type?
Which symbol is used for single-line comments in JavaScript?
What is the default return value of a function that does not explicitly return anything?
Which statement is true about arrow functions in JavaScript?
choices: They always have their own 'this' context
They inherit 'this' from their surrounding scope
They must always have a return statement
questions.answer: They inherit 'this' from their surrounding scope

choices: To convert an object to a JSON string
